intro: Bunium cylindricum, commonly known as the cylindrical fennel, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, cylindrical stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in arid regions of Central Asia. Bunium cylindricum is also known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine.
